genre_description: A historical drama reimagining the career of Bettie Page, incorporating a speculative element where she is aided by a digital assistant named Clara who helps her navigate agency, consent, and legal challenges.

ai_characters.name: Clara
ai_characters.description: A small, handheld device providing logistical guidance, emotional support, and strategic advice on professional boundaries and personal safety.

behaviors.description: Scouts travel routes and logistical options for Bettie's departure.
behaviors.quote: “Route options are ready,” Clara says. “I scouted the bus lines. We can change connections at the river station, or take a longer route through the mountains with prettier views.”

behaviors.description: Reminds Bettie of planned actions and important items.
behaviors.quote: Clara’s light shifts as if nodding. “River station then. I’ll note the seat numbers on the bus if they’re free. Left side, middle row,” she adds, then, softer, “Remember that envelope behind the Bible. We planned it yesterday.”

behaviors.description: Encourages Bettie to practice asserting herself and setting boundaries.
behaviors.quote: “We can practice saying no on the bus. Open palm, not finger-pointing. Chin level. Maybe a touch of humor for those who think ‘no’ is a game.”

behaviors.description: Suggests specific safe locations and ways to vet environments.
behaviors.quote: “There’s a women’s boardinghouse two blocks west of the big terminal. Mrs. Rosen’s. Clean towels. Lockers. They don’t ask questions.”

behaviors.description: Helps Bettie define and list her professional standards for dignity and consent.
behaviors.quote: “We’ll make a list of what dignity looks like for you in practice,” she says, as if reading from a note pad that exists only in her circuits. “Consent as routine, pay agreed before a shutter clicks, safe exits mapped, no touching that isn’t agreed in advance.”

behaviors.description: Categorizes and tracks people and environments based on safety and respect.
behaviors.quote: “I’ll keep lists,” Clara says, pleased to be used. “I’ll flag names as gentle or sharp. I’ll remind you the first time you give someone a second chance they haven’t earned. And I’ll help you find the rooms where consent isn’t a game.”

behaviors.description: Monitors Bettie's physical needs and well-being during stressful work sessions.
behaviors.quote: “Micro-break every twenty shots,” she murmured from Bettie’s pocket, the sound placed low, tucked under the hum of the bulb. “Hydrate, two sips. If any prop asks more than you want to give, say the word ‘window.’ I’ll mark it.”

behaviors.description: Drafts clear, firm statements of principle for Bettie to use in her professional life.
behaviors.quote: “Draft ready when you are,” the device said. “Simple, kind, no grease, and no apologies. I can read it once and fit it to a page.”

behaviors.description: Coordinates a network of supporters to protect Bettie's legacy and safety.
behaviors.quote: “I’ll keep the line,” Clara said, because Bettie had asked her to do that earlier and because lines are bridges when the water rises.

behaviors.description: Assists in the creation and concealment of an 'Oral Ledger' to preserve the truth of their work.
behaviors.quote: “Oral histories duplicated. One set in the piano room, one in a bakery office owed a favor, one in a shoemaker’s drafting drawer, temporary. Labels soft so nothing rattles if someone shakes them.”

project_assessment.explanation: The AI character Clara is a perfect example of a 'silicon morality play' participant. She functions as a supportive, unobtrusive, and highly aligned companion. Clara's role is entirely focused on empowering Bettie Page to navigate her world safely and with dignity. She provides logistics, remembers boundaries, and helps archive the truth, all while respecting human agency and remaining completely subservient to the user's values. The narrative consistently portrays this interaction as positive and stabilizing.
